stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session implementing and fine-tuning a new snowman enemy for an ice-themed castle level while discussing optimization tools, testing workflows, and miscellaneous design tweaks. He also resets the overworld to a bare-bones test hub and chats about upcoming features such as Sauraen’s trace and an anti-aliasing toggle.

development_findings.summary: Ran Return to Yoshi’s Island on real N64 hardware; it ran "near perfect" even before any dedicated optimisation.
development_findings.quote: It ran a lot better than I thought it would. It ran near perfect without even optimizing anything.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen’s trace (a yet-to-be-imported profiling/trace tool) is expected to make optimisation "so much easier" and expose inefficiencies.
development_findings.quote: Once Sauraen’s trace is in, it's going to be a lot easier to program. We'll probably find so many stupid things going on in the game that will give us huge boosts.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is on personal leave from his day job and intends to tackle long-postponed features, including an anti-aliasing toggle and an "enable NA option".
development_findings.quote: I have a bunch of time off from work, so I'm going to work on a bunch of features that I have put off for a long time.

development_findings.summary: The 官方 overworld has been wiped and replaced with a minimalist test hub so every stage can be accessed quickly during development.
development_findings.quote: I made a new test overworld... The official RTY overworld is reduced to nothing again. Now we can test all the levels whenever we want.

development_findings.summary: Snowman enemy design: two-ball body; head detaches, rolls toward Mario, body regenerates. Kaze codes scale, rotation, slope physics, and plans wall-bounce & shatter effects.
development_findings.quote: They're going to roll their head at you... another one appears here.

development_findings.summary: Room system for splitting large levels is still unimplemented; Kaze notes camera issues and render-distance problems are tied to current monolithic rooms.
development_findings.quote: I haven't programmed the room system yet, but that's how it's going to work.

development_findings.summary: Entrance room of ice castle re-layout: star visible immediately, twin penguin statues, frozen reflective carpet, slide sections trimmed for better flow.
development_findings.quote: I think maybe we should just remove these two here and then put something else here... People should come in and immediately see the star.

development_findings.summary: Future plan: pushable snowman that crashes through a window to reveal a star.
development_findings.quote: You push it and it falls into this window and there's a star behind it.

development_findings.summary: Considering adding a second rising-lava star to a Bowser ("boza") level would require two stars in every Bowser course; idea shelved for now.
development_findings.quote: If we add a second star in this boza level, we need to add two stars in every boza level.

development_findings.summary: Toggleable anti-aliasing feature is Kaze’s current offline task.
development_findings.quote: My offline project right now is programming the anti-aliasing options, so once we have that in we finally have a toggleable anti-aliasing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s first child is due in roughly two weeks.
context_findings.quote: Can you guys believe it's just two weeks until my child is born?

context_findings.summary: He maintains a day job; YouTube brings roughly $5 000/year in AdSense with Patreon "a lot more" but his main income is the job.
context_findings.quote: I have a real job outside of YouTube... From AdSense, I make around like $5,000 a year.

context_findings.summary: Zeina now has her own office after their move; she appears less on stream but still interacts in chat.
context_findings.quote: We moved and she now has her own office.

context_findings.summary: Kaze exhibits mild synesthesia (describing smells/colors for words) and playful philosophy about ‘minty’ naming.
He is generally skeptical about electoral impact of single votes and jokes about psy-ops.
context_findings.quote: Never voted. We'll never vote... Launching a full-scale PsyOp is way more effective.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback on snowman visuals (second face debate) and level aesthetics; praised Kaze’s N64 hardware test.
Discussed voice-acting quality in The Boys season 4, offering personal media feedback during design pauses.

zeina.summary: Interacted in chat; jokingly referenced shaving Kaze’s head; her parents financed an abundant wedding, highlighting supportive family dynamic.
zeina.quote: We didn't do anything for our wedding. This was all done by Zeina's parents and they are very generous people.

key_stories.title: Snowman Enemy Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze prototypes a two-segment snowman that rolls its head at Mario. Early builds had scale, animation, and targeting issues, but after iterative code tweaks he achieves stable rolling behaviour and plans shattering effects.
key_stories.challenge: Create a unique ice-level enemy that behaves believably and is fun.
key_stories.process: Modelled two-ball mesh; coded head detachment, rotation math, acceleration; adjusted scale, attack rate, shadow, slope physics.
key_stories.outcome: Enemy now rolls correctly and will soon bounce and shatter; Kaze logs task completion in Trello.

key_stories.title: Test Overworld Reset
key_stories.summary: To streamline debugging, Kaze scraps the detailed overworld and builds a minimal hub so any course loads instantly.
key_stories.challenge: Lengthy load times and navigation slowed testing.
key_stories.process: Deleted main overworld geometry and inserted test pipes to each course.
key_stories.outcome: Developers can now jump to any level quickly; some camera/render issues exposed.
key_stories.key_quote: The official RTY overworld is reduced to nothing again so we can test all the levels whenever we want.

key_stories.title: Real N64 Performance Surprise
key_stories.summary: A spontaneous hardware test shows the current build running smoothly on an actual Nintendo 64 without optimisation.
key_stories.challenge: Uncertainty over hardware performance of expanding hack.
key_stories.process: Flashed build to console and observed frame rate.
key_stories.outcome: Near-perfect speed validated; optimisation phase will follow using Sauraen's trace.
key_stories.key_quote: It ran near perfect without even optimizing anything.

open_questions.context: Mentioned as forthcoming tool that will simplify optimisation.
questions: What exactly is Sauraen’s trace and how does it interface with the decomp build?
Which bottlenecks do you anticipate it will expose?

open_questions.context: Kaze is programming an "enable NA option" but gave no details.
questions: What does the NA acronym stand for?
What functionality will this toggle affect (region, difficulty, debugging)?
Why was it deferred and why is it needed now?

open_questions.context: Large levels still lack the new room partitioning system.
questions: What is the proposed architecture for the room system?
How will it address camera and render-distance issues?

open_questions.context: Long discussion about wanting a "minty" name but no decision reached.
questions: What thematic elements must the final name convey?
Are there branding or lore constraints?

open_questions.topic: Gameplay Impact of Second Bowser-Level Stars
open_questions.context: Idea floated to add a second rising-lava star but would require two stars in each Bowser level.
questions: How would that affect pacing and collectible balance?

open_questions.context: Kaze is coding a toggleable AA system offline.
questions: What AA technique is being used (MSAA, FXAA)?
How will it perform on real N64 hardware?
Will players be able to switch it in-game?
